greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum of primes dividing the n-th squarefree positive integer.
comment: For n > 1: sum of row n in A265668. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 13 2015
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Since the 5th squarefree positive integers is 6 = 2*3, the 5th term of the sequence is 2 + 3 = 5.
mathematica: Table[DivisorSum[n, # &, PrimeQ], {n, Select[Range@ 113, SquareFreeQ]}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 23 2017 *)
program: a111060 n = sum $ a265668_row n -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 13 2015
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Oct 07 2005
